segment.source: How to Migrate the App-V SQL Database to a Different SQL Server
segment.target: How to Migrate the App-V SQL Database to a Different SQL Server

segment.source: How to Migrate the App-V SQL Database to a Different SQL Server
segment.target: How to Migrate the App-V SQL Database to a Different SQL Server

segment.source: How to Migrate the App-V SQL Database to a Different SQL Server
segment.target: How to Migrate the App-V SQL Database to a Different SQL Server

segment.source: The following procedures describe in detail how to migrate the SQL database of the Microsoft Application Virtualization (App-V) Management Server to a different SQL Server.
segment.target: The following procedures describe in detail how to migrate the SQL database of the Microsoft Application Virtualization (App-V) Management Server to a different SQL Server.

segment.source: Important
segment.target: Important

segment.source: This procedure requires that the App-V server service is stopped and this will prevent end-users from using their applications.
segment.target: This procedure requires that the App-V server service is stopped and this will prevent end-users from using their applications.

segment.source: To back up the App-V SQL database
segment.target: To back up the App-V SQL database

segment.source: Open the Services.msc program and stop the App-V Management Server service on all Management Servers that use the database to be migrated.
segment.target: Open the Services.msc program and stop the App-V Management Server service on all Management Servers that use the database to be migrated.

segment.source: On the computer where the App-V database is located, open SQL Server Management Studio.
segment.target: On the computer where the App-V database is located, open SQL Server Management Studio.

segment.source: Expand the Databases node and locate the App-V database (default name is APPVIRT).
segment.target: Expand the Databases node and locate the App-V database (default name is APPVIRT).

segment.source: Right-click the database and select Tasks and then select Back Up.
segment.target: Right-click the database and select Tasks and then select Back Up.

segment.source: Verify that Recovery model is set to SIMPLE and the Backup type is set to Full.
segment.target: Verify that Recovery model is set to SIMPLE and the Backup type is set to Full.

segment.source: Change the Backup set and Destination settings if it is necessary.
segment.target: Change the Backup set and Destination settings if it is necessary.

segment.source: Click OK to back up the database.
segment.target: Click OK to back up the database.

segment.source: After the backup has completed successfully, click OK.
segment.target: After the backup has completed successfully, click OK.

segment.source: Open Windows Explorer and browse to the folder that contains the database backup file, for example APPVIRT.BAK.
segment.target: Open Windows Explorer and browse to the folder that contains the database backup file, for example APPVIRT.BAK.

segment.source: Copy the database backup file to the destination computer that is running SQL Server.
segment.target: Copy the database backup file to the destination computer that is running SQL Server.

segment.source: To restore the App-V SQL database to the destination computer
segment.target: To restore the App-V SQL database to the destination computer

segment.source: On the destination computer, open SQL Server Management Studio, right-click the Databases node and select Restore Database.
segment.target: On the destination computer, open SQL Server Management Studio, right-click the Databases node and select Restore Database.

segment.source: Under Source for Restore, choose From device and then click the “…”
segment.target: Under Source for Restore, choose From device and then click the “…”

segment.source: button.
segment.target: button.

segment.source: In the Specify Backup dialog box, make sure that the Backup Media is set to File and then click Add.
segment.target: In the Specify Backup dialog box, make sure that the Backup Media is set to File and then click Add.

segment.source: Select the backup file that you copied from the original computer that is running SQL Server, and then click OK.
segment.target: Select the backup file that you copied from the original computer that is running SQL Server, and then click OK.

segment.source: Click OK and then click to select the backup set to restore.
segment.target: Click OK and then click to select the backup set to restore.

segment.source: Under Destination for restore, click the drop-down for To database and select the App-V database name, for example APPVIRT.
segment.target: Under Destination for restore, click the drop-down for To database and select the App-V database name, for example APPVIRT.

segment.source: Click OK to start the restore.
segment.target: Click OK to start the restore.

segment.source: After the restore has completed successfully, click OK.
segment.target: After the restore has completed successfully, click OK.

segment.source: Expand the Security node, right-click Logins and select New Login.
segment.target: Expand the Security node, right-click Logins and select New Login.

segment.source: In the Login Name field, enter the Network Service account details for the App-V Management Server in the format of DOMAINSERVERNAME$.
segment.target: In the Login Name field, enter the Network Service account details for the App-V Management Server in the format of DOMAINSERVERNAME$.

segment.source: On the General page under Default database select the App-V database name, for example, APPVIRT, and then click OK.
segment.target: On the General page under Default database select the App-V database name, for example, APPVIRT, and then click OK.

segment.source: Under Select a page, click to select the User Mapping page.
segment.target: Under Select a page, click to select the User Mapping page.

segment.source: Under Users mapped to this login, click the check box in the Map column to select the App-V database.
segment.target: Under Users mapped to this login, click the check box in the Map column to select the App-V database.

segment.source: Under Database role membership for: appvdatabasename, click to select SFTEveryone and then click OK.
segment.target: Under Database role membership for: appvdatabasename, click to select SFTEveryone and then click OK.

segment.source: Make sure that the Windows Firewall on the new computer that is running SQL Server is configured to allow the App-V Management Server to access the system.
segment.target: Make sure that the Windows Firewall on the new computer that is running SQL Server is configured to allow the App-V Management Server to access the system.

segment.source: Under Administrative Tools, use the Windows Firewall with Advanced Security program to create an Inbound Rule for the port that is used by SQL Server (default is port 1433).
segment.target: Under Administrative Tools, use the Windows Firewall with Advanced Security program to create an Inbound Rule for the port that is used by SQL Server (default is port 1433).

segment.source: To migrate the App-V SQL Server Agent jobs
segment.target: To migrate the App-V SQL Server Agent jobs

segment.source: On the original computer that is running SQL Server, in SQL Server Management Studio, expand the SQL Server Agent node, and then expand the Jobs node.
segment.target: On the original computer that is running SQL Server, in SQL Server Management Studio, expand the SQL Server Agent node, and then expand the Jobs node.

segment.source: Right-click the following four App-V jobs and select Script Job as | CREATE to | File, and save each script to a folder and give each script a descriptive name.
segment.target: Right-click the following four App-V jobs and select Script Job as | CREATE to | File, and save each script to a folder and give each script a descriptive name.

segment.source: Softgrid Database (appvdbname) Check Usage History
segment.target: Softgrid Database (appvdbname) Check Usage History

segment.source: Softgrid Database (appvdbname) Close Orphaned Sessions
segment.target: Softgrid Database (appvdbname) Close Orphaned Sessions

segment.source: Softgrid Database (appvdbname) Enforce Size Limit
segment.target: Softgrid Database (appvdbname) Enforce Size Limit

segment.source: Softgrid Database (appvdbname) Monitor Alert/Job Status
segment.target: Softgrid Database (appvdbname) Monitor Alert/Job Status

segment.source: Copy the four script files (.sql) to the destination computer that is running SQL Server and open SQL Server Management Studio.
segment.target: Copy the four script files (.sql) to the destination computer that is running SQL Server and open SQL Server Management Studio.

segment.source: In Windows Explorer, right-click each .sql file and then click Run.
segment.target: In Windows Explorer, right-click each .sql file and then click Run.

segment.source: Each script will open in a query window in SQL Server Management Studio.
segment.target: Each script will open in a query window in SQL Server Management Studio.

segment.source: Click Execute for each script and verify that each is completed successfully.
segment.target: Click Execute for each script and verify that each is completed successfully.

segment.source: Refresh the Jobs node under the SQL Server Agent node and confirm that the four jobs are created successfully.
segment.target: Refresh the Jobs node under the SQL Server Agent node and confirm that the four jobs are created successfully.

segment.source: To update the configuration of the App-V Management Server
segment.target: To update the configuration of the App-V Management Server

segment.source: On the App-V Management Server, modify the following registry keys:
segment.target: On the App-V Management Server, modify the following registry keys:

segment.source: SQLServerName newservername
segment.target: SQLServerName newservername

segment.source: SQLServerPort newserverport
segment.target: SQLServerPort newserverport

segment.source: Then restart the App-V server service.
segment.target: Then restart the App-V server service.

segment.source: Browse to find the file SftMgmt.udl under the App-V Management Server installation directory (default is C:Program FilesMicrosoft System Center App Virt Management ServerApp Virt Management Service).
segment.target: Browse to find the file SftMgmt.udl under the App-V Management Server installation directory (default is C:Program FilesMicrosoft System Center App Virt Management ServerApp Virt Management Service).

segment.source: Right-click the file and select Open.
segment.target: Right-click the file and select Open.

segment.source: On the Connection tab, enter the name of the destination computer that is running SQL Server, and then click Test Connection.
segment.target: On the Connection tab, enter the name of the destination computer that is running SQL Server, and then click Test Connection.

segment.source: When the test is successful, click OK and then click OK again.
segment.target: When the test is successful, click OK and then click OK again.

segment.source: For App-V Management Server versions before 4.5 SP2, you must update the SQL Logging settings.
segment.target: For App-V Management Server versions before 4.5 SP2, you must update the SQL Logging settings.

segment.source: Under Server Groups, right-click the server group the server is a member of and select Properties.
segment.target: Under Server Groups, right-click the server group the server is a member of and select Properties.

segment.source: On the Logging tab click to select the SQL Database entry and then click Edit.
segment.target: On the Logging tab click to select the SQL Database entry and then click Edit.

segment.source: Change the DNS Host Name to the host name of the new computer that is running SQL Server and then click OK.
segment.target: Change the DNS Host Name to the host name of the new computer that is running SQL Server and then click OK.

segment.source: Click OK two times more, and then restart the App-V server service.
segment.target: Click OK two times more, and then restart the App-V server service.

segment.source: Open the App-V Management Console, right-click the Applications node and select Refresh.
segment.target: Open the App-V Management Console, right-click the Applications node and select Refresh.

segment.source: The list of applications should be displayed as before.
segment.target: The list of applications should be displayed as before.
